title: 📚 Google Cloud Platform (GCP) - Complete Introduction
text:
🌟 Welcome to GCP Journey!

title: 📚 Google Cloud Platform (GCP) - Complete Introduction
text:
🏢 The Problem Before Cloud (Pre-2010)


Traditional Challenges

💰 Expensive physical servers
🏗️ Data center setup
🔧 System administration teams
🌡️ Temperature control systems
🔌 Networking infrastructure


Result

More than 50% effort on infrastructure


Less than 50% on actual application!

title: 📚 Google Cloud Platform (GCP) - Complete Introduction
text:
💡 The Cloud Solution


Before Cloud 🏢

Company → Buy Servers → Setup DC → Hire Teams → Build App
↓         ↓            ↓          ↓         ↓
💸💸💸     🔧🔧🔧      🌡️🌡️🌡️    👥👥👥    📱



With Cloud ☁️

Company → Request Resources → Build App → Pay for Usage
↓            ↓               ↓          ↓
🚀         ⚡ Instant      📱 Focus    💰 Save

title: 📚 Google Cloud Platform (GCP) - Complete Introduction
text:
📊 Key Benefits of Cloud Computing

💰 Cost Efficiency - No upfront infrastructure investment
📈 Scalability - Dynamic resource adjustment

🔧 Maintenance-Free - Provider handles everything
🌍 Global Reach - Worldwide data centers
⚡ Speed - Deploy in minutes, not months

title: 📚 Google Cloud Platform (GCP) - Complete Introduction
text:
🌍 Public Cloud


Characteristics

🤝 Shared Resources among customers
🌐 Internet Accessible
👥 Third-party Managed
💰 Most Cost-Effective
📊 90% of companies use this


Examples





AWS







GCP

title: 📚 Google Cloud Platform (GCP) - Complete Introduction
text:
🏛️ Private Cloud


Use Cases

🏦 Banks & Financial Institutions
🏥 Healthcare Organizations

🏛️ Government Agencies
🔒 High Security Requirements


Characteristics

🛡️ Dedicated Resources
🔐 Higher Security
💸 More Expensive
🔧 Self-Maintained

title: 📚 Google Cloud Platform (GCP) - Complete Introduction
text:
🔄 Hybrid Cloud Strategy


Smart Data Distribution

graph TB
A[Company Data] --> B[Sensitive Data]
A --> C[Non-Critical Data]
B --> D[Private Cloud 🔒]
C --> E[Public Cloud 🌍]

    D --> F[Customer Info<br/>Financial Records<br/>Internal Documents]
    E --> G[Marketing Content<br/>Public Policies<br/>Website Data]
    ```
:::
:::

---

# 🏆 GCP vs AWS vs Azure

## 📈 Market Share Comparison {.center}

::: {.fragment}
| Provider | Market Share | Strength |
|----------|-------------|----------|
| **AWS** 🟧 | 31-33% | 🏆 Largest ecosystem |
| **Azure** 🔵 | 21-24% | 📈 Fastest growing |
| **GCP** 🟢 | 11% | 🤖 AI/ML Leadership |
:::

---

## 🎯 GCP Unique Selling Points

::: {.incremental}
- **✅ Proven Scalability** - Powers Gmail & YouTube
- **⚡ Performance Focus** - Billions of concurrent users
- **🤖 AI/ML Leadership** - Advanced capabilities
- **💰 Competitive Pricing** - Often more cost-effective
- **🌐 Global Network** - Google's infrastructure
:::

::: {.fragment}
### 🔍 Key Insight
*All providers offer similar features - competition is about **implementation quality***
:::

---

# 💳 GCP Free Account & Pricing

## 🎁 Free Tier Benefits {.smaller}

::: {.columns}
::: {.column width="50%"}
### 💰 Credits & Trial
- **$300 free credits** (90 days)
- **No automatic charging**
- **Full platform access**
:::

::: {.column width="50%"}
### 🆓 Always-Free Products
- 1 E2-micro instance/month
- 5GB Cloud Storage
- BigQuery queries (1TB/month)
- Cloud Run requests
- **20+ products included!**
:::
:::

---

## ⚠️ Important Limitations {.center}

::: {.fragment .fade-in}
### 🚨 Watch Out For
:::

::: {.incremental}
- ❌ **No monthly rollover** - Use it or lose it
- 💸 **Charges apply** when exceeding limits  
- 📊 **Monitor usage** carefully
- 🏦 **Remove bank auto-debit** for peace of mind
:::

---

# 🔧 Essential Cloud Vocabulary

## 💻 Virtualization Explained

::: {.r-stack}
::: {.fragment .current-visible}
### Physical Server Reality
🖥️ Physical Server (64 CPU, 512GB RAM) ↓ 👤 One Customer Uses Only 2 CPU, 4GB RAM ↓ 😢 Massive Resource Waste!
:::

::: {.fragment .current-visible}
### Virtualization Solution
🖥️ Physical Server (64 CPU, 512GB RAM) ↓ ⚙️ Hypervisor Layer ↓ 🖥️ VM1: 2CPU,4GB 🖥️ VM2: 4CPU,8GB 🖥️ VM3: 8CPU,16GB Customer A Customer B Customer C
:::
:::

---

## 🔌 Three Ways to Access Applications

::: {.columns}
::: {.column width="33%"}
### 🖱️ UI (User Interface)
- Web browsers
- Visual interaction
- Point & click
- **Best for beginners**
:::

::: {.column width="33%"}
### ⌨️ CLI (Command Line)
- Terminal commands
- Faster execution
- Automation friendly
- **Best for experts**
:::

::: {.column width="33%"}
### 🔗 API (Programming)
- Python, Java, etc.
- Full automation
- Integration ready
- **Best for developers**
:::
:::

---

## 🗺️ Regions and Availability Zones

::: {.fragment}
### 🌍 Geographic Distribution
Region: us-central1 🇺🇸 ├── Zone: us-central1-a (Data Center 1) ├── Zone: us-central1-b (Data Center 2) └── Zone: us-central1-c (Data Center 3)
:::

::: {.fragment}
### 🎯 Why This Matters
- **⚡ Low Latency** - Deploy closer to users
- **🛡️ Disaster Recovery** - Backup locations
- **📈 High Availability** - 24/7 uptime
:::

---

## 📈 Performance & Reliability Concepts {.smaller}

::: {.columns}
::: {.column width="50%"}
### 📊 Scalability vs Elasticity
- **Scalability**: Handle more requests
- **Elasticity**: Auto-scale up/down
:::

::: {.column width="50%"}
### 🛡️ Availability vs Fault Tolerance
- **High Availability**: 24/7 uptime
- **Fault Tolerance**: Works despite failures
:::
:::

::: {.fragment}
### ⚖️ Load Balancing
*Distributing requests across multiple application copies*
👥👥👥 Users → ⚖️ Load Balancer → 🖥️🖥️🖥️ App Servers
:::

---

# 🏗️ GCP Resource Hierarchy

## 📊 Organization Structure {.center}

::: {.r-stack}
::: {.fragment .current-visible}
### 🆓 Free Account Structure
👤 Google Account ↓ 📁 Projects ↓ ⚙️ Resources (VMs, Storage, etc.)
:::

::: {.fragment .current-visible}
### 🏢 Enterprise Structure
🏢 Google Workspace Organization ↓ 📂 Folders (Departments) ↓ 📁 Projects (Teams) ↓ ⚙️ Resources (Applications)
```

title: 📚 Google Cloud Platform (GCP) - Complete Introduction
text:
❓ Basic Cloud Computing Questions

Q1: What is cloud computing and why is it important?


A: Cloud computing delivers computing services over the internet, eliminating the need for companies to maintain data centers. It reduces costs through pay-as-you-use pricing and provides scalable resources on-demand.

title: 📚 Google Cloud Platform (GCP) - Complete Introduction
text:
❓ Cloud Models Comparison

Q2: What are the main differences between public, private, and hybrid cloud?


A: Public cloud is shared infrastructure by third parties (AWS, GCP), private cloud is dedicated infrastructure for one organization, and hybrid cloud combines both - using private for sensitive data and public for non-critical workloads.

title: 📚 Google Cloud Platform (GCP) - Complete Introduction
text:
❓ GCP Specific Questions

Q3: Why choose GCP over AWS or Azure?


A: GCP offers proven scalability (powers Gmail/YouTube), strong AI/ML capabilities, competitive pricing, and Google’s global network. AWS has largest market share, while Azure integrates well with Microsoft ecosystems.

title: 📚 Google Cloud Platform (GCP) - Complete Introduction
text:
❓ Technical Concepts

Q4: What is virtualization in cloud computing?


A: Virtualization allows multiple virtual machines to run on a single physical server using a hypervisor. It enables cloud providers to efficiently share physical resources among multiple customers while maintaining isolation.

title: 📚 Google Cloud Platform (GCP) - Complete Introduction
text:
❓ Free Tier Questions

Q5: Explain GCP’s free tier offerings.


A: GCP offers $300 in free credits for 90 days for new users, plus always-free products including 1 E2-micro instance, 5GB cloud storage, and limited usage of 20+ services. Charges apply only when exceeding these limits.

title: 📚 Google Cloud Platform (GCP) - Complete Introduction
text:
✅ What We Learned Today

🌐 Cloud computing revolutionized application deployment
🏆 GCP offers proven scalability with Google’s services as proof
💳 Free tier provides excellent learning with $300 credits
🔧 Understanding vocabulary is essential for any cloud platform
🎯 Provider choice depends on needs, not just features

title: Interactive Python with JupyterLite
text:
This document demonstrates how to embed a full JupyterLite environment in your Quarto website.


The following iframe embeds a live Python REPL powered by JupyterLite:





For a complete notebook experience, you can embed the full JupyterLab interface:






REPL Mode: Use the first embed for quick Python code execution and testing
Full Lab Mode: Use the second embed for complete notebook functionality
Packages Available: Includes NumPy, Pandas, Matplotlib, Plotly, and more via Pyodide




If you want to use your own JupyterLite deployment, simply replace the src URL:

title: Interactive Bash Terminal
text:
This page provides direct access to your WSL bash environment through a web-based terminal powered by ttyd.



 






Click inside the terminal to start typing commands
Use resize buttons above the terminal to adjust size

Right-click in terminal for copy/paste options
Press F11 in the iframe for full browser terminal mode







Warning



Troubleshooting: If the terminal doesn’t respond to input: 1. MOST IMPORTANT: Ensure ttyd is running with writable mode: ttyd -W -p 7681 bash 2. Try refreshing the page 3. Click directly in the terminal area 4. Check that port 7681 is accessible
